ref: 9704 máṅkatē ʻ moves ʼ Dhātup. [Cf. maṅkú -- ʻ staggering (?) ʼ ŚBr. (durmaṅku -- ʻ refractory ʼ lex.), Pa. maṅku -- , BHSk. maṅku -- , maṅgu -- , madgu -- ʻ disturbed in mind ʼ BHS ii 414, which EWA ii 547 considers not of Drav. origin (see DED 3890)]
Pk. maṁkia -- n. ʻ advancing by leaps ʼ;
Bhoj. mã̄kal ʻ to jump, leap ʼ Gupta Grām 242.
